sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: BRICS leaders meet in Johannesburg and discuss expansion and replacing the dollar as the world's dominant currency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Dramatic scenes in Pakistan as all eight people stranded in a broken cable car are brought to safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: BRICS leaders are holding a three-day summit in South Africa as the group of emerging economies seeks to challenge Western dominance in global affairs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa represent a quarter of the global economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: One notable absentee is Russian President Vladimir Putin on the grounds of an international arrest warrant over alleged war crimes in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov is representing him, but in a pre-recorded message, Putin hailed the BRICS new development bank as an alternative to Western financial institutions and predicted the decline of the U.S. dollar. The summit's main session in Johannesburg is scheduled for Wednesday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: when the leaders will mull over possible expansion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The BRICS countries, with a population of 3 billion people, is now ahead of the Western-dominated G7 nations in terms of purchasing power,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: forecast for 2023 at 31.5% against 30%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 2023 at 31.5% against 30%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: These pictures recorded from a Philippine Coast Guard show the latest sovereignty standoff between Beijing and Manila in the disputed South China Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Chinese Coast Guard vessels blocked the passage to Philippine Coast Guard vessels

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: for hours on Tuesday near the second Thomas Shoal, an area claimed by the Philippines where they maintain a military ship and had sent supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: China, asserting its claim over the region, allowed the passage of two vessels carrying supplies citing humanitarian reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Beijing is embroiled in numerous sovereignty disputes in these waters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Despite setbacks in international courts, it's pursuing an increasingly assertive policy, causing concern among other regional nations and the United States, which closely monitors China's activities in waters through which one-third of the world's maritime traffic flows. Ukrainian forces say they have recaptured a clutch of territory around the eastern war-battered

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: town of Bakhmut, but have made no major advances on the southern front, according to the country's deputy defence minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, evidence of Ukrainian attacks beyond Russian front lines has been released. Ukraine media has confirmed that Ukrainian saboteurs coordinated by Kyiv's military intelligence carried out a pair of recent drone attacks that hit parked bomber aircraft at air bases deep inside Russia. Hours later Russia's Air Force scrambled two jets to force two drones near the Crimean Peninsula according to the Russian Defense Ministry. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky has just returned from a whirlwind trip to three European capitals. Washington gave European countries permission to send keyed US.-made F-16 fighter jets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Ukraine's government is intensifying its clampdown on corruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Dozens of raids were conducted on military enlistment offices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The probes follow allegations that officials helped citizens to obtain disability certificates to avoid military service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Amidst the steel-on-steel, frontline fighting, terrified civilians, safe at last. Это такая всякая еда. 52 было в летку.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Я вам скажу, у меня были шикарные подарки.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Мне подарили пирожки с шелковицей.

sentences.sentence: Подарили три хлеба.

sentences.sentence: Мама принесла букет троян.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: А Кум принес пиво ящика бубликов, который нашел у оккупантов.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: All eight people have been rescued from a stricken cable car high above a remote valley in Pakistan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Army commandos were helped by civilian volunteers in the Kaibapuktuungwa province to reach the remaining three people late on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Six schoolchildren were among those who had been left hanging in the broken cable gondola for nearly 15 hours while their families looked on desperately.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The daring rescue began with the rescue plucking two children to safety after almost 12 hours in the air.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But as daylight faded, the chopper was forced back to base in the dark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Then rescuers used the cable keeping the gondola from plunging into the valley as a zip line to rescue the rest of those stranded late into the night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Cable cars are common across the northern areas of Kaibapukto Mwa province and are vital in connecting villages and towns in areas where roads cannot be built.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The wildfires which are burning in Greece have also affected Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Turkish firefighters have been trying to control the flames of a forest fire in the border province of Çanakkale, where 1,200 people from nine villages have been evacuated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: More than 1,500 hectares are burned and 48 people had to be treated for smoke inhalation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The fire also forced the suspension of maritime traffic from the Dardanelles Strait.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: About 30 vessels, several of them deep draft, had to interrupt their voyage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Spain's King Felipe has given Alberto Núñez Fejo, leader of the conservative Popular Party,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: first shot at forming a new Spanish government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Fejo's party won the most seats in last month's inconclusive national election and will now try to create a coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, even with the backing of the far-right Vox party, Fejo's Populist Party will still fall short of a majority government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It means acting Socialist Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez could get a chance to stay in power for four more years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: French riot police are on patrol in the working class neighbourhood of Pisse-Savannes, outside the southern town of Nîmes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It follows Monday's fatal shooting of a 10-year-old boy in suspected drug-related violence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The boy was traveling in a car with his uncle when they were targeted at around 11.30 p.m. local time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Police are working on the assumption that the attack was carried out because of mistaken identity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It follows a recent series of drug-related violent acts in southern France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Japan is set to release treated radioactive water from the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant on Thursday, despite protests from neighboring countries and demands from China and South Korea to reconsider the decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Seoul, protesters took to the streets accusing Tokyo of jeopardizing the safety of South Koreans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: China called the release of radioactive water a wrong decision and called on Japan to correct it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Beijing says the ocean is a common property of all humankind and promised to take all necessary measures to safeguard the marine environment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Japan has cooperated with the International Atomic Energy Agency in the plan to discharge treated water contaminated at the plant in 2011 when an earthquake and tsunami wrecked Fukushima, melting three reactors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The water has been stored in a thousand tanks and treated with what's called an advanced liquid processing system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The financial districts of London to a large extent carry the fortunes of the UK economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The forecast was for an exodus of jobs post-Brexit, but the most pessimistic anticipated job losses of more than 250,000 within UK financial services did not materialise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The latest figures of staff relocations stand at around 7,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, data from the Global Financial Centres Index underscores a significant shift with cities like Paris, Amsterdam, Frankfurt and Munich, registering notable jumps. London's still seen as a global financial player, but it isn't necessarily seen as the single European financial services centre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And I think that is what has changed as a result of Brexit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now people think it's not just London that's a European financial centre, it is other places. It could be Paris, it could be Amsterdam, it could be Dublin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Using incentives to encourage investment, European cities like Dublin are stepping into the spotlight as new centres for banking. The evidence shows that what was once predicted as a mass exodus of city bankers from London has in fact transpired as a strategic recalibration of resources around European banking hubs to rival the City of London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Peter Lawler is the former chief economist of the German Stock Exchange. He believes European centres like Frankfurt have been a step ahead of London, but that it's too early to know what the long-term impact of Brexit on financial services is going to be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I don't think the strategic thinking was properly done in the UK. And of course, Paris is very keen, Frankfurt is very keen. You know about the various incentives that were put forward in various European cities. But all that said, where are we going to end up ultimately, whatever ultimately may mean, it's too soon to say.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A recalibration of power, but the story of Brexit's impact on finance in Europe is far from over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, London.
